issue.title: [PDTS] Unclear why range-based-for functions return different types

discussion.p: It is unclear why the range-for support functions (begin()/end()) for directory_iterator and recursive_directory_iterator return different types for begin() and end(), namely that begin() returns a reference to const and end() returns a value.

p.i: [2014-02-07: Beman Dawes provides comments from the Boost implementation:]

discussion.p: The difference in return types becomes relevant, when testing whether e.g. directory_iterator would satisfy the Traversable requirements as currently specified in N3763. Expressed in code form these requirements impose that the following assertion holds:
Both directory_iterator and recursive_directory_iterator won't satisfy this requirement currently.
discussion.note: 2014-02-11 Issaquah: Change begin() argument and return to pass-by-value. See wiki notes for rationale. Beman to provide wording for review next meeting.

li.p: These functions enable use of directory_iterator with C++11 range-based for statements.
These functions enable use of recursive_directory_iterator with C++11 range-based for statements.
